content.description: Stand start with any combination that works. From there, get your feet up on the mini-shelf using a pair of sloping pockets, then go straight up through a pair of edges/pinches to reach an easy mantel.
content.protection: A pair of pads will work. The landing is perfect.
content.location: It climbs the center of Aegis' east face.

content.description:
SDS down and left on the south face. Small foot pockets under the rooflet help make the initial left hand movement from downpuller to sidepull, crimp rail. Make your way up and right to the sloper + edge on the arete. Match on this hold and slide around to the right on the east face. Complete the remainder of

Stilt Fiction

.
content.location: This ascends the Southeast arete of Aegis Rock.

content.description:
Stilt Fiction climbs a slightly overhung arete on perfect slopers.

Stand start with a left hand at the arete and a high right hand on a crescent-shaped crimp. From there, make a big right hand move to a perfectly textured sloping edge, slap the left hand further up the arete till reaching the better pinch/slopers, find a high foot edge, and continue up the arete's bumps, commit to the slab, and mantle on top the boulder.
content.protection: A few pads should do it, the landing is great, but is slightly sloping.
content.location: This ascends the north face of Aegis Rock.

content.description:
Stereoglyph ascends a nice slab on a good assortment of pockets and edges.

Stand start (crux) with a pair of one finger pockets about five feet off the ground. From there, work up through a pair of thin edges, gain an oblique right hand edge, then work a pair of horizontal edges a foot below the lip, and top it out.
content.protection: A few pads will do it, the immediate landing is good, but there is a tree directly behind the landing.
content.location: ThIs ascends the southern part of the east face.

content.description:
Squint Skyward and Listen climbs great rock over a great landing.

Stand start with hands matched on the pinch-edges. From there, reach a right hand smiley edge-pinch, reach a left hand next to it on a two-finger pocket, gain the left hand edge at the lip, follow through a pair of sloper bumps to reach a right hand pinch-edge up high on the slab, mantle with the left hand on the lip edge, commit to the better edge with the right, finish up the remaining slab.
content.protection: At least a pair of pads. The landing is very good though.
content.location: It climbs the center of Aegis' west face.

content.description: Sit start with a left hand edge and a right hand sidepull. From there, work up the slab on the edges, sidepulls, and teardrop to reach a mantle for the finish.
content.protection: A pad or two will do. The landing is very good.
content.location: It climbs the northwest slab-arete of Aegis.

content.description:
Sit start with hands on the big rail, and make large moves to and from smallish pockets up and left to join

Stilt Fiction

.
content.location: This ascends the East face of the boulder. Locate rail at approximately 3 feet for the start holds. The good feet are below.

content.description: Stand start with a left hand edge and a right hand crescent sidepull. From there, climb straight up to a crossover sidepull feature, reach the sloping bumps and the subsequent top out.
content.protection: A pad will work, the landing is very good.
content.location: It climbs the southwest section of Aegis' west face.

content.description:
The problem climbs a bulging face on a nice assortment of holds over a good landing.

Sit start with hands matched on a large edge. From there, traverse right a few feet along the rail, reach a right hand crimp, bump that same hand up to a sharp edge, follow with the left hand to a tooth-edge, gain the good feet, and climb up through the remaining slopers to reach the finish.
content.protection: A pad or two will work fine. The landing is very good, but there is a small tree just left of the fall zone.
content.location: It climbs the vertical seam on the west face of Aegis.
